intro: Soranthe ciliciiflora, commonly known as the Cyprus starwort, is a rare flowering plant native to Cyprus. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants like buckwheat and sorrel. The species is characterized by its star-shaped flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in rocky or limestone soils in open habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
